Context:
Program Name: Interaction Design
Code: G113
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years
Method of Study: Full-time
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $8,648.00 *
International Tuition: $21,100.00 **
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Design
Location: Waterfront Campus
Program Description: Interaction Design is an interdisciplinary field that merges design skills with coding fundamentals to create meaningful experiences between users and digital platforms. The program covers topics like usability, spatial relations, human factors, and immersive environments through a hands-on learning experience.
Field Education Options: Students with a GPA of 3.3 or higher by the end of semester 4 and a B+ on the portfolio assignment (semester 5, GRAF3014) will be eligible for the Field Placement course (GRAF3017) in semester 6.
Related Programs: Graphic Design (G102), Art and Design Foundation (G108)

Context:
EXTRACTED INFORMATION:

The Placement course (GRAF3017) is offered in semester 6. The text discusses Experiential Learning opportunities at the School of Design, including details on how to apply, important dates, workflow, and PLAR eligibility. After graduation from this program, students will be prepared for roles in various digital media studios with careers such as: information architect, interaction designer, mobile designer, mobile developer, production artist, 3D visualization artist, motion designer, user experience designer, user interface developer, web designer, web developer, SEO/SEM specialist.

The required courses for the first semester are INTR 1001 - 2D Visualization (prerequisite: none), INTR 1002 - Information Architecture 1, INTR 1003 - Visual Design, INTR 1005 - Technical Drawing 1, and COMM 2000 - Communicating Across Contexts. The second semester includes courses such as INTR 1011 - 3D Visualization 1, INTR 1002 - Information Architecture 2, and INTR 1007 - Design, Technology and Humans. There is no explicit mention of key information related to the name or contact details of the college in the provided text.

Context:
EXTRACTED INFORMATION:

The text provides information about courses offered in Semesters 5 and 6 for the Informatics (INTR) program at the college. Here are the facts extracted from the text:

1. The courses listed are for General Education Electives under the Informatics program.
2. Semester 5 courses include INTR 3002 - Device Development 1, INTR 2012, INTR 3006, Portfolio 1, INTR 2016, INTR 3008, Interactive Systems Project 1, INTR 2016, INTR 3010, Immersive Media 1, and INTR 3013 - Human Computer Interaction.
3. Semester 6 courses include INTR 3012 - Device Development 2, INTR 3002, INTR 3018, Interactive Systems Project 2, INTR 3008, INTR 3020, Immersive Media 2, INTR 3010, INTR 3024, and Interaction Design Studio Lab.
4. Students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) before progressing to COMM 2000. However, this course does not count as a required course for graduation and will incur an additional charge.
5. The graduate of the program is expected to demonstrate various abilities, including collaborating in a team environment, applying tools, assessing project requirements, designing complex media projects, making interactive products using appropriate technologies, performing work compliant with regulations and codes of ethics, using research skills for optimal user experience, and recommending human computer interaction design guidelines.
6. The text mentions the Assessment Centre for more information.

Therefore, the extracted information includes the courses offered in Semesters 5 and 6, a potential requirement to take an additional course, and the expected abilities of the graduate from the Informatics program at the college.

Program Information:
- Interactive experience delivery and contribution to various platforms and environments
- Design solution creation in accordance with strategies, recommendations, and methodologies

- Domestic Tuition (Fall 2023): $8,648.00 *
- International Tuition (Fall 2023): $21,100.00 **
- Domestic Tuition (Fall 2024): Not specified
- International Tuition (Fall 2024): Not specified
- Additional Costs: Estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the first two semesters
- Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)

- Portfolio *

- Fees subject to change without notice

- Mature students may take Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade their English credits

Context:
The text contains information about requirements for admission to a program at George Brown College, course exemptions, contacts for domestic and international students, and details about the location and facilities of the School of Design. Here is the extracted information:

- Admission: Meeting minimum requirements does not guarantee admission; applicants may need higher grades. (No specific program mentioned)
- Course Exemptions: College or university credits can qualify for course exemptions. More information can be found on the Transfer Guide. (No specific program mentioned)
- International Students: Should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. More information can be found on the International Admissions and How to Apply pages. They may also contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry via the International Contact Us page.
- Contacts: School of Design - Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 3129; Email: interaction@georgebrown.ca. Program Co-ordinators: Nastaran Dadashi ([Nastaran.Dadashi@georgebrown.ca](mailto:Nastaran.Dadashi@georgebrown.ca)) and Toni Allen ([Toni.Allen@georgebrown.ca](mailto:Toni.Allen@georgebrown.ca)). General inquiries can be made to the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
- Location: The program is part of the School of Design, located at the Waterfront Campus, 3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
- Facilities: The School of Design building features virtual and augmented reality lab, usability and testing lab, Future Ways of Living lab, peer tutor lab, digital sandbox, incubators, prototyping and workshop spaces, design and innovation showcase spaces.
- Information sessions and Campus tours: Potential students can attend information sessions to have questions answered, learn about program content and career options, meet professors and staff, and experience a George Brown College classroom. They can also book a campus tour or explore the virtual tour online.
- Related programs: Graphic Design (G102) and Art and Design Foundation (G108).
